definition: hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: One-quarter of the country is reckoned as unproductive .
sentences.chinese: 這個國家有四分之一被認爲是不毛之地。

sentences.english: For if dreams go. Life is a barren field. Frozenwith snow.
sentences.chinese: 如果夢想消失了，生活就變成了積滿冰雪的不毛之地。

sentences.english: The farmers turned the sterile land into high fields.
sentences.chinese: 農民們把不毛之地變成了高產田。

sentences.english: Out in the sticks? Don't be nuts.
sentences.chinese: 在那種不毛之地過日子？你別傻了。

sentences.english: The land was denuded of vegetation.
sentences.chinese: 這塊土地曾是不毛之地。

sentences.english: Due to the bad soil, the earth is barren.
sentences.chinese: 由於土質太差，那裏可謂是不毛之地。

sentences.english: The Bible is to a thirsty soul what water is to a barren land.
sentences.chinese: 聖經能滿足飢渴心靈，如不毛之地忽逢甘霖。

sentences.english: We shall turn this piece of wasteland into wheat fields.
sentences.chinese: 我們要把這塊不毛之地改成麥田。

sentences.english: Antarctica wasn't always a frozen wasteland.
sentences.chinese: 南極大陸並非總是冰封的不毛之地。

sentences.english: The farmers turned the sterile land into high yields.
sentences.chinese: 農民們把不毛之地變成了高產田。

definition: lit. barren hills and wild rivers (idiom)/fig. inhospitable natural environment
lit. not even a blade of grass grows (idiom)/fig. barren
dark and uninhabited (idiom); remote and deserted/God-forsaken
left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
